intro: Dichapetalum mucronulatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. The plant is notable for its milky sap, which is toxic and has been used traditionally for various purposes.
